about.text: Driven and adaptable software engineer with a passion for crafting innovative solutions that  optimize functionality and enhance user experiences, back-end and front-end. Committed to  leveraging a strong foundation in software development to contribute to cutting-edge projects  and drive technological advancement. Seeking opportunities to collaborate within dynamic teams, tackle complex challenges, and continue to grow professionally, all while delivering high-quality, eﬃcient, and sustainable LEAST CODE software solutions. Aspirations, through time employed and building personal projects, are to meet and overcome client’s needs and allow data to serve its purpose through well-kempt storages and visualizations.

projects.name: IoT Table Hub
projects.description: Built a coffee table with the capability to control many IoT instances of household. Touch pad used lazer depth perception to allow touching glass that had a projection of the User Interface instead of a touch screen. Used IFTTT for workflows and built in a sdk for text based queries to google home. Integrated APIs as well like Roku Remote API for additional functionality.

projects.name: Generator Efficiency Monitoring
projects.description: Full Stack Program using Cloud Architecture. Generates random inputs and outputs for generators and creates Dynamic RESTful Endpoints in test, then collects and aggregates generator data to send to consumer that performs efficiency modeling and stores in AWS S3 DataLake. A RESTful API is now accessible for a front-end REACT Website to display user indicated generator efficiency charts using past data and predictions by linear regression.

projects.name: Targeted Resident Renewals
projects.description: Python Script that collects 2 csv files including an alpha list and renewal list and joins the tables to collect certain residents who need to be targeted for renewals.

projects.name: Vipir
projects.description: User Interface that connected to Google’s YouTube API via Oauth. Allowed filtering and video display to allow users to watch desired videos. Team used GitHub to collaborate and GitHub’s Version Control along with Atom’s Teletype to connect independent code segments.

projects.name: HACKLAHOMA Project - ForFarmersOnly
projects.description: Uses Twilio API to allow farmers to send text messages for grain donations instead of using 4g or internet, which is scarce in most rural locations. If the donation is at least an eighth of the bin itself, the farmer will experience a free bin cleaning which alleviates the farmer of the need to clean the bin themselves. Follows a quip pro quo methodology.

projects.name: Automated Speed Testing
projects.description: Used abandoned computer with Wi-Fi adapter as Linux Server to Main Distribution Frame Access Point and run script to access 2.4g and 5g bands to test download and upload speeds of apartment community and submit forms for Speed Testing.

education.degree: B.S. in Computer Science | Minor in Mathematics
